metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2905 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory read flaw was found in the Linux kernel's BPFsubsystem in how a user calls the bpf_tail_call function with a key largerthan the max_entries of the map. This flaw allows a local user to gainunauthorized access to data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-53-generic - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-5.15.0-53-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-generic - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-generic-64k - 5.15.0-53.59
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-kvm - 5.15.0-1021.26
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-53.59').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1021.26').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1023.27').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1023.29').

linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.20').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1004.4').
